channel.title: Prompt
channel.description:
I have been *trying* to create a god damn batch script that will
1. Copy the contents of the files Module, Profile, Org in the local directory to /build/module, /build/profile, /build/org
I know it is simple, but for some reason i cannot get the damn thing to work. Anyone know?
Note: And yes, i've googled.

item.title: Prompt
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“zstars, post:2, topic:90856”]Assuming you are using Windows, and that the files in fact don’t have a termination.

copy Module "build/module" copy Profile "build/profile" copy Org "build/org" [/quote]
That is exactly what i was doing, but it wasn’t working it seemed.

Read full topic

item.title: Prompt
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

Assuming you are using Windows, and that the files in fact don’t have a termination.

copy Module "build/module"
copy Profile "build/profile"
copy Org "build/org"

Read full topic
